resources.string: London-based, multi-national indie band Useless Cities offer up a sonic journey powered by reverb soaked guitar lines and alternating male/female vocals.
London-based, multi-national indie band Useless Cities offer up a sonic journey powered by reverb soaked guitar lines and alternating male/female vocals.

Since arriving fully formed in 2016, Useless Cities have been busy playing a string of live shows around London (including recent headline gig at The Finsbury) and nationally, including gigs in Brighton, Newcastle and Scotland, building a fanbase for their unique take on nineties and noughties-influenced shoegaze-rock.

After two EP releases so far, they have also picked up radio acclaim from BBC 6Music’s Fresh Faves & Amazing Radio, plus rave press coverage with XS Noize, Soundchip, She Makes Music, Vents Magazine and many more. Latest single ‘Eyesore’ (produced by Paul Tipler of Idlewild/Slowdive/Elastica fame) premiered on GigSlutz. 2018 will see a further two singles (produced by Paul Tipler) released in the Spring, along with a narrative video directed by Deborah Espect. Latest Single ‘Couldn’t Ask For More’ was released on 23/03/2018.
Developed by Patrik Krizek. All rights reserved.
